title: Private Equity Faces Paying for Portfolio Company Misdeeds
sub_head: Private-equity firms are more often facing charges over the conduct of the companies they own, a break from precedent
body: In 2012, Christine Martino-Fleming realized there was a major problem at South Bay Medical Center Inc., a Massachusetts mental-health treatment provider where she worked as a staff trainer.
